traceability.evidence: The project includes a dedicated src/xml-formatter.js and wiring in src/print-outdated.js and bin/dry-aged-deps.js to support `--format=xml`. Vitest ran 89/89 tests with full coverage (~90.8% lines), including 14 XML-specific formatter tests (xml-formatter.test.js, summary, object, error, thresholds, partial branches, no-detail, no-thresholds) and 4 CLI XML tests (cli.format-xml.test.js, cli.format-xml.error.test.js, printOutdated.xmlEmpty.test.js, printOutdated.xmlFetchError.test.js). All tests for valid XML declaration, schema structure, summary, escaping, error handling, exit codes (0/1/2), help text, and suppression of console noise passed without errors.
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for the XML output story have been met: `--format=xml` is accepted, XML is well-formed and covers complete data and summary sections, exit codes behave correctly, errors are serialized as XML, console warnings are suppressed, schema branches (thresholds, vulnerabilities) are conditional and correct, and help/README documentation lists XML as a valid format.
